channel.title: Forums and Hosting
channel.description:
Hey guys,
I was wondering if some of you could help me out you own your own forum / have your own hosting.
I was just wondering what type of hosting you have, where you bought it from, and if you would recommend it or not. A friend of mine is looking to host a big website with forums and I just wanted a quick run down on what you guys would recommend.
Also, what other forum types am i missing?
[ul][*]vBulletin [*]SMF [*]phpbb[/ul]
Any others you would recommend me to check out?
Thanks a lot
Starblaster100

item.title: Forums and Hosting
item.dc:creator: @LegendaryLoser .Flair
item.description:
@LegendaryLoser wrote:

NationVoice is a very good host. It’s rather easy to use, has a nice control panel, full FTP support, supports any file and has Fantastico (Easy forums/Databases/mySQL DB)

You can have up to three from one e-mail and it’s 500MB each.

Read full topic

item.title: Forums and Hosting
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

For forums software, SMF hands down.

For hosting the only host I have found that is decent is veritynet.net (kib) if you want a dedicated, otherwise I can tell you who NOT to go with, netfirms.com and startlogic.com both have screwed me over at least once.

Read full topic

item.title: Forums and Hosting
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

[quote=“leader, post:32, topic:134332”][quote author=io9 link=topic=185719.msg1681720#msg1681720 date=1187378126]
If you want a really good [paid] host, try BlueHost. I never had problems with them, account activation is almost instant, free domain, 300GB webspace, and 3TB transfer, at only $7 USD a month.
[/quote]

The sites that have offers like these are overselling their hosting. If you pass a certain server load limit (cpu), they will suspend your account.

What about yahoo hosting? I haven’t tried them, but they are probably good.

Small Business

Best Website Hosting Service - Cheap Web Hosting - Yahoo Small Business

Website hosting starting at $2.65/month! Enjoy 24/7 support and our 30-day trial! Yahoo Small Business is a one-stop shop for your professional website. Are you ready for cheap website hosting?


I never had any problems with CPU overloading. Soooo, ya.

Read full topic

item.title: Forums and Hosting
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

io9:

If you want a really good [paid] host, try BlueHost. I never had problems with them, account activation is almost instant, free domain, 300GB webspace, and 3TB transfer, at only $7 USD a month.

[quote=“io9, post:29, topic:134332”]Also, I forgot to mention the Dylock uses BlueHost.
http//bluehost.com/[/quote]

Only problem is that in their terms of service (https://www.bluehost.com/terms_of_service.html), there’s this little piece of heaven:

Foul language and profanity in the site content, and in the domain name are prohibited.

Also, there’s some more crap in the ToS. Could have been a good host.

Personally, I’d recommend InMotion Hosting (www.inmotionhosting.com).

Read full topic

item.title: Forums and Hosting
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

For forums, I would either suggest vBulletin or SMF, but if you like vBulletin’s Satellite skin, get that for SMF(this forum has it for those who don’t know, fiddle about in the “Profile” tab), for hosting, I don’t know. Sorry.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Starblaster100 Starblaster100
item.description:

item.title: Forums and Hosting
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

[quote=“MybJames, post:13, topic:134332”][quote author=I_own_mopar link=topic=185719.msg1681464#msg1681464 date=1187372229]
SMF is shit
[/quote]
You’re an arrogant little fucknut aren’t ya.[/quote]

Read his posts, he has obviously been banned on another account and come here to cause drama, but he obviously hasn’t realized yet that no one cares about his little E-fit.

Anyway, i wouldn’t go for a hosting that is not based in you’re own country because for one, No long distance phone calls, two, if they “accidentally wipe” you’re site you can go down and gang bash them all.

Read full topic

item.description:
@MybBob wrote:

[quote=“Starblaster100, post:1, topic:134332”]Hey guys,

I was wondering if some of you could help me out you own your own forum / have your own hosting.

I was just wondering what type of hosting you have, where you bought it from, and if you would recommend it or not. A friend of mine is looking to host a big website with forums and I just wanted a quick run down on what you guys would recommend.

Also, what other forum types am i missing?

[ul][]vBulletin
[]SMF
[*]phpbb[/ul]

Any others you would recommend me to check out?

Thanks a lot

Starblaster100[/quote]

www.siteground.com has some great hosting offers, and as for the forum situation use SMF, VB Is good but SMF Is open source and can look good with the right skin.
